topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Post-Alpha Release Build 22: Deploying the VRSvApp

p.i: Return to the Installing the KVM + ESX Deployment.

body.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in the KVM + ESX Deployment requires the VRSvApp. One VRSvApp is required for each ESX host. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between each VRSvApp and its ESX host. The VRSvApp installation package is contained in the packages you downloaded from DCN.

The following describes how to install the vSphere Solution. The installation is as simple as deploying the new vCenter Integration Node. When using the vSphere Solution method, the VRS-VM will be deployed automatically as Agents on every single ESXi node in a Cluster.

ul.li: vCenter Integration Node = standalone VSD deployment Toolbox
HTTP_DHCP VM = VM that will host HTTP and DHCP services required for deploying VRSvAPP on each ESXi host.
vCenter Integration Node should have one NIC in the Cloud Lab Management network.
HTTP server should host VRS vApp vMware template accessible via url. Server should have one network interface in the DVRS Datapath network (TUL Network)
DHCP server should have one network interface in the DVRS Datapath network (TUL Network)

body.section: Installing the vCenter Integration NodeThe vCenter Integration Node is bundled in the same installable VM as the VSD Node. As such, the installation steps for this integration node are the same as for the VSD Standalone Node. Once you install this VM as described in the VSD Standalone install instructions, the UI and API can be accessed at <url>:8443/vcenter/.Any further configuration required will be described in the vCenter plugin guide.

section.p: This HP DCN vSphere Solution includes a UI and API called the vCenter Deployment Toolbox. To access the UI point a browser to https://<VSD_IP>:8443/vcenter/. Only the CSPRoot user can log into the vCenter deployment toolbox.

Configuring the VSD Deployment Toolbox:The MetaData Plugin is bundled as part of the vCenter Integration node. The metadata plugin needs to be installed once the vCenter Integration node is up and running.
To install and configure the metadata plugin:
Stop the JBoss application server on the the vCenter Integration node.
SSH into the vCenter Integration node.
Execute the following command: monit stop jboss
Edit the the /opt/vsd/jboss/standalone/configuration /metadataplugin.properties. Enter vCenter properties the in the fields, as follows:vc.host=x.x.x.x //: This is the vCenter IP address: vc.http.proxy.port = 80 //: This is the default port. Do not change. vc.https.proxy.port = 443 //: This is the default port. Do not change. vc.user = root //: vCenter username vc.password =vmware //: vCenter password
Start the JBoss application server using the following command::monit start jboss
The monit start jboss Metadata plugin is automatically deployed and installed upon. The plugin will be listed as registered in vCenter.

section.title: Configure the Deployment Toolbox
section.p: You must perform the following tasks.
You must provide the VMWare topology configuration to the deployment toolbox. This includes the following:

ul.li: Each ESX hypervisor in the cluster(s)
Each HP DCN cluster(s) in data center(s)

section.p: The vCenter configuration requires the following:
The data center and cluster configurations require matching the names of the vCenter configuration objects on vCenter.
The ESX hypervisor inside the cluster is identified based on its IP.

When adding a new vCenter to the deployment toolbox, make sure the VRS-VM template is configured in vCenter. The template is required for all the DCN-enabled hypervisors on that vCenter. The template must be available over an HTTP server, and must allow connection from vCenter and from the Nuage-enabled hypervisors.

The VSD Deployment Toolbox offers the option of setting up a default vApp profile for all the VRS VM Agents. The profile is used for all default parameters, which generally remain the same across all your agents. The configuration on the default profile includes all the VRS vApp nodes, except the ones that are obviously different for each VRS-VM agent (such as the IP address).

Each level of the topology can be overridden in order to provide different parameters at a more granular level. If a parameter is configured on the level of the default profile, on the cluster level and also on the ESXi level, then only the ESXi-level parameter will be used.

p.b: Enabling the agent settings on each hypervisor

section.p: Each VM that needs to be configured with the Nuage VRS-VM Agent needs to be configured with generic bootstrapping agent settings.

To configure these settings:
In the vSphere web client, select the Hypervisor in the Nuage Cluster.
Click Manage, then Settings, then Agent VM Settings.
Click the Edit button.
Configure the Datastore and Bootstrap Network settings.
The Bootstrap Network is the network on which the VRS VM issues DHCP requests and issues requests to the vCenter integration node in order to receive all its parameters.

section.title: Adding the Cluster to the Agency
section.p: After adding the vCenter topology to the deployment toolbox, configure the cluster on vCenter for Agent use.
Note: Make sure that the cluster and hypervisor profiles are properly configured on the deployment toolbox before proceeding to add the cluster to the Agency.
Perform the following steps using the vSphere web client:

ol.li: Log in to the vSphere web client, which is at https://<vcenter IP>:9443/vsphere-client.
From the Home tab, navigate to vCenter Solutions Manager as shown below:
Click on the vCenter Solutions Manager to see a list of extensions, including NuageVRS Agent Manager, as shown below:

Click the Nuage VRS Agent Manager and navigate to the Solutions tab.
If a warning about a certificate issue appears, navigate to https://<vcenter_IP>:8443/EamPlugin-1.6.0/. Confirm the security exception and add the certificate. A message indicating that EAM is up and running appears, and you can continue with the next step:

Add the Nuage cluster:
On the left hand side of vCenter, select the cluster managed by Nuage from the list of all the clusters present in vCenter.
Add the cluster managed by Nuage to the right hand side.
Click Update Configuration. The Agent VMs will be deployed on that cluster.
(Optional) To remove the cluster, select the cluster and click first Remove, then Update Configuration.
